channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How North Carolina erased medical debt for 2.5 million people
item.description: The state partnered with a nonprofit to wipe out the debts. It also has a plan in place to prevent medical debt for people in specific income brackets...

item.title: 1 year into Trump's second term, a consumer watchdog agency is 'hanging by a thread'

item.title: Greetings from Kalk Bay, a South African fishing village where wild seals await scraps
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: What to expect from Trump's Davos speech. And, the DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials

item.title: Legal battles over immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota intensify
item.description: Confrontations with federal officers over their massive immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota are showing no signs of stopping.

item.title: House Oversight voting on holding Clintons in contempt in Epstein probe
item.description: Republicans escalated the standoff with Bill and Hillary Clinton after they refused to appear in person before the committee.

item.title: Could US Congress stop Trump from taking over Greenland?
item.description: Some of the president's fellow Republicans oppose him - but it's not clear if they would join Democrats to block a takeover of the island.

item.title: Detained veteran Ugandan opposition figure critically ill in hospital, his party says
item.description: Kizza Besigye’s party says his condition is critical, but authorities say he was taken to hospital for a routine check-up.

item.title: Trump says he won't take Greenland by force as allies push back at Davos
item.description: President Trump told world leaders, CEOs and policymakers at the Davos economic forum that he wouldn't use force to take control of Greenland.

item.title: Israel postpones demolition of Palestinian children's football pitch
item.description: An international campaign to save the pitch in the occupied West Bank city of Bethlehem appears to have forced the authorities to reconsider.

item.title: 2026 Songwriters Hall of Fame inductees revealed on "CBS Mornings"
item.description: The 2026 Songwriters Hall of Fame inductees were revealed on "CBS Mornings" on Wednesday. See the full list.

item.title: Israeli PM Netanyahu agrees to join Trump's Board of Peace
item.description: Israel is the latest country to publicly accept an invitation to Trump's new organisation, joining Albania, Bahran, Hungary, Morocco and the UAE.
